# Failed Articles Report
# Generated: 2026-01-11
# Total failed: 147

## Root Cause

The Exa API returns an empty results list for certain URLs.

When we call:
    result = exa.get_contents([url], text=True)
    content = result.results[0].text  # <-- IndexError here

For failed URLs, `result.results` is an empty list `[]`, so accessing
`result.results[0]` raises "IndexError: list index out of range".

## Debug Trace Example

URL: https://kexue.fm/archives/9862

>>> result = exa.get_contents(["https://kexue.fm/archives/9862"], text=True)
>>> print(type(result))
<class 'exa_py.api.SearchResponse'>
>>> print(len(result.results))
0
>>> print(result.results)
[]

Exa simply doesn't return any content for these URLs. This could be due to:
- Page not indexed by Exa
- Page blocked by robots.txt
- Page requires JavaScript rendering
- Temporary Exa service issues
- Rate limiting

## Failed URLs (147 total)
